byline.contributor: Wissam Nassar contributed reporting from Gaza City.
byline.original: By DIAA HADID and MAJD AL WAHEIDI

abstract: Series of bombings targeting Hamas in Gaza Strip, including four attacks in May, have been attributed to extremist Islamist groups that vow loyalty to Islamic State and are attempting to challenge Hamas's power in region; groups, known as salafi-jihadis, have been energized by ISIS victories in Iraq and Syria; latest clashes are sign of their growing power.
lead_paragraph: An Islamist group calling itself Supporters of the Islamic State has conducted a bombing campaign against Hamas, whom it claims is not sufficiently extreme.

headline.main: ISIS Allies Target Hamas and Energize Gaza Extremists
headline.print_headline: ISIS Allies Target Hamas and Energize Gaza Extremists

snippet: An Islamist group calling itself Supporters of the Islamic State has conducted a bombing campaign against Hamas, whom it claims is not sufficiently extreme.
